sect3.title: Overview
sect3.para: This filter fills the active layer's alpha with a starburst gradient and adds a shadow.
It is derived from the Starburst script-fu ( File Create Logos Starburst in the image window), which creates a logo from a text.
You can use this filter to create shapes filled with the above starburst motif:

itemizedlist.para: This filter uses four layers (three of them will be created by the filter):

caption.para: Layers after applying the Starburst filter

listitem.para: The Burst layer contains the bursting star, created by the Supernova filter.
The active layer was named layer #2 in the example above. It has been filled with the Crack pattern, so the content of this layer doesn't matter. Only the active layer's alpha channel does.

warning.para: The image will always be resized to the active layer's size.

listitem.para: The Shadow layer contains a drop shadow in the same shape but slightly extended size of the active layer's alpha channel.
The Background layer: this is a new layer filled with the Background color.

sect3.title: Activate the filter
sect3.para:
You can find this filter in the image window menu under
Filters Alpha to Logo Starburst .

listitem.para: Just ignore this option. It's nonsense. (This is actually the font size option of the Starburst Script-Fu script. You can still use it to vary the offset (size) of the lower right shadow, though: effect size * 0.03.)

This color will be passed to the Supernova filter as the color of the bursting star; it defaults to green. A click on the color swatch button brings up the color selector, where you can choose another color.
This is the color used to fill the Background layer; it defaults to white. When you click on the button, you may choose any other color in the color selector dialog.
